medical_history.chief_complaint: Severe congenital hypothyroidism and mental retardation.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms were suspected in the first month of life due to feeding problems, failure to thrive, a hoarse cry, somnolence, and a large protruding tongue. Desiccated thyroid treatment started in the first month of life was irregular with several interruptions until the age of 22. Thyroid function was abnormal at the age of 9 but no precise results were traced. At first admission at age 22, the patient had not received thyroid medication for about 6 weeks.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Congenital hypothyroidism identified in infancy; irregular thyroid treatment.
medical_history.family_history: Father had a nontoxic nodular goiter and died in a car accident years before; mother and one sister had small diffuse goiter.
medical_history.social_history: Raised in a mountain village in southern Italy; parents were nonconsanguineous.
